page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: A LITTLE WAY OUT OF WEST TANFIELD, NEAR LOWSIDES FARM, IS A FISH HATCHERY. THE FISH ARE REARED FROM EGGS AND THE YOUNG TROUT ARE PUT INTO THE RIVER URE, TO PROVIDE SPORT FOR THE ANGLING CLUB MEMBERS. THE FEE TO JOIN THE CLUB IS Â£250 FOR NEW MEMBERS PLUS Â£250 EACH YEAR. MR STURDY, THE WATER BAILIFF, SHOWED US THE PONDS IN WHICH THE YOUNG TROUT ARE REARED. THE RAINBOW TROUT ARE BROUGHT FROM CALIFORNIA AND THE BROWN TROUT COME FROM MALTON IN THE VALE OF PICKERING. THE EGGS, ABOUT 15,000 ARE PUT IN THE PONDS IN EARLY SPRING. ABOUT 70% OF THE EGGS DIE EACH YEAR. TO PROTECT THE YOUNG FISH FROM DIPPERS, KINGFISHERS AND WATER VOLES, MR STURDY HAS A WIRE NET ABOVE EACH POND. SPRING WATER IS CONTINUALLY RUNNING THROUGH THE PONDS.
